definition: to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)

sentences.chinese: 它与上下文无关，并且毫不含糊。

sentences.english: Experience tells us that the answer is an unambiguous yes.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们答案是可以，毫不含糊。

sentences.english: In my opinion the answer is an unequivocal “yes”.
sentences.chinese: 按我的意见，答案毫不含糊，是肯定的。

sentences.english: The answer was clear and unambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 这个答案很明了，不含糊。

sentences.english: I am not afraid of you.
sentences.chinese: 不含糊你，这确实是个好东西。

sentences.english: Scientists do say very unequivocally what the problem is.
sentences.chinese: 科学家对问题所在毫不含糊。

sentences.english: Men have many words for their genitals, and none of them are vague.
sentences.chinese: 男人性器官的词儿可多着了，一个一个毫不含糊。

sentences.english: UBS, for its part, offers the more sober prediction that Brazil will win the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 瑞银方面给出的预测就更不含糊，巴西队棒杯。

sentences.english: "The matter with me is that I am hungry," replied Gavroche frankly.
sentences.chinese: “我要吃的，我肚子饿，”伽弗洛什毫不含糊地回答。

sentences.english: But the picture from the doctor’s office unambiguously does.
sentences.chinese: 但是，医生办公室的照片毫不含糊地说明了。

sentences.english: She's a professional in work but a novice in love.
sentences.chinese: 对于工作一点不含糊，可是对于恋爱完全是低能儿。

sentences.english: We are for the large shape because it has the impact of the unequivocal.
sentences.chinese: 我们选择大号尺幅是因为其毫不含糊的冲击力。

sentences.english: Is the description exact and not vague?
sentences.chinese: 描述是清楚的和不含糊的吗？

sentences.english: Peking man will most unequivocal choice of a "first car."
sentences.chinese: 多数北京人会毫不含糊地选择“先买车”。

sentences.english: First, the administration of the economic recovery plan has to be squeaky clean.
sentences.chinese: 首先，打算振兴经济的政府必须毫不含糊地作到廉洁。

sentences.english: Indeed, Bennett's critics have been harshand unequivocal.
sentences.chinese: 其实，本内特受到的批评相当严厉而且毫不含糊。

definition: see 沒說的|没说的[mei2 shuo1 de5]
see 乾脆利落|干脆利落[gan1 cui4 li4 luo5]
hardly/not in the least/not at all
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
(of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
